title: Illinois FOIA Request—Death Investigation of Christian Acosta (June 13, 2018) (Westmont Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To:
 FOIA Officer
 Village of Westmont Police Department
 500 North Cass AvenueTo:
 FOIA Officer
 Westmont Police Department
 500 North Cass Avenue
 Westmont, IL 60559
 foia@westmont.il.gov

 FOIA Officer
 DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office
 505 N. County Farm Road
 Wheaton, IL 60187
 SAOFOIA@dupageco.org

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 This request is made pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.

II. Records Requested
 Please produce all records, in any format, relating to the investigation into the death of Christian Acosta on or about June 13, 2018, including but not limited to any and all records referencing or involving Tanya Marie Anderson. This request specifically includes, but is not limited to, the following:

 A. Incident & Investigative Reports
  • Initial, supplemental, and closing police reports, detective narratives, and case summaries.
  • Crime scene diagrams, photographs, and video or body-camera footage.
  • Evidence collection logs, property sheets, and chain-of-custody forms.

 B. Medical & Forensic Records
  • DuPage County Coroner’s report, autopsy findings, and toxicology results.
  • EMS run sheets or fire-department responder reports.
  • Any forensic laboratory submissions and results (fingerprints, DNA, drug analysis).

 C. Communications & 911 Audio
  • Computer-aided dispatch (CAD) logs, 911 call recordings, radio traffic, and MDT messages.
  • Emails, texts, or memoranda between Westmont Police Department, DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office, and any other agency regarding this death investigation.

 D. Interview Materials
  • Witness statements, interview transcripts, and audio/video recordings of interviews of Tanya Marie Anderson, Christian Acosta, Hernando Acosta, or any other person interviewed in connection with the case.

 E. Prosecutorial Disposition
  • Referral letters, charging recommendations, declination memoranda, or case-closure letters issued to or received from the DuPage County State’s Attorney’s Office.
  • All internal memoranda, notes, or communications regarding charging decisions, investigative strategy, or legal analysis of the case.

 F. Administrative & QA Files
  • Any internal-affairs reviews, case-audit worksheets, or supervisory critiques of investigative handling.
  • Retention or destruction logs referencing audio/video or evidence in this case.

III. Time Frame
 Records created or received 1 January 2017 – Present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Electronic format preferred (.pdf, .mp4, .wav, .jpg), delivered via secure download link or encrypted USB.
 • If electronic production is infeasible, please advise of available alternatives.

V. Fee Waiver
 Disclosure will contribute to the public’s understanding of a death investigation involving potential interstate criminal conduct; I therefore request a waiver of any search, duplication, or administrative fees under 5 ILCS 140/6(c). If fees are unavoidable and expected to exceed $50, please provide advance written notice.

VI. Expedited Processing
 The requested records are material to ongoing state and federal proceedings (Dane County Case No. 2023FA836; U.S. Attorney complaint filed June 2025). Prompt release is essential to preserve litigation deadlines.

VII. Preservation Notice
 Please halt routine deletion or recycling that could affect responsive audio/video or digital evidence until this FOIA request is resolved.

VIII. Partial Disclosure & Exemptions
 Should you assert any exemption, produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory basis (5 ILCS 140/7) for each withheld segment. Provide an itemized exemption log sufficient to allow meaningful review.

IX. Preferred Communication
 Kindly confirm receipt of this request via email and direct any questions to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I look forward to your written determination within the statutory period prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3(d).

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

title: Illinois FOIA Request—Death Investigation of Christian Acosta (June 13, 2018) (Dupage County State's Attorney's Office)

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To:
 Records Custodian / Open-Records Officer
 Wisconsin Department of Health Services — Office of Inspector General (OIG)
 1 West Wilson Street, Room 650
 Madison, WI 53703

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39 and related common-law principles requiring government transparency in matters of alleged fraud and agency accountability, I respectfully request access to the public records listed in Section II.

II. Records Requested
 A. Case-Specific Investigation Files (2019 – Present)
  1. Entire investigative files—including complaints, intake notes, interview transcripts, audit work-papers, overpayment ledgers, recommended actions, and closing memoranda—relating to FoodShare, Wisconsin Shares, or Pandemic Unemployment Assistance fraud investigations that list Jessica Cooper or Angie Dempewolfe as investigator, analyst, supervisor, or subject.
  2. All correspondence (letters, emails, texts, Teams/Zoom chat logs) between either individual and:
   • Waunakee Police Department personnel;
   • Dane County CPS employees;
   • Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;
   • Tanya Marie Anderson, Tammy Pomplun, or Attorney Elisabeth Bach-Van Horn.

 B. Policy, Training & Delegation Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical OIG or Division of Quality Assurance manuals, standard-operating procedures, desk guides, or policy bulletins that define:
   • Authority of fraud investigators to refer matters for criminal prosecution;
   • Documentation standards for Intentional Program Violation findings;
   • Duties to disclose exculpatory information to law-enforcement partners.
  2. Training curricula, slide decks, sign-in sheets, and assessment tools provided to Cooper or Dempewolfe regarding common-law fraud elements, theft-by-fraud (Wis. Stat. § 943.20), and civil-restitution procedures (Wis. Stat. § 895.446).

 C. Oversight & Quality-Assurance Data
  1. Internal audits, peer-review summaries, or performance dashboards evaluating fraud-case closures handled by Cooper or Dempewolfe.
  2. Any complaints, disciplinary findings, or supervisory corrective-action plans naming either individual and referencing misrepresentation, negligence, or selective enforcement.

 D. Communications With Federal Partners (2020 – Present)
  • All referrals, memoranda, or email chains between DHS-OIG and USDA-FNS, SSA-OIG, or U.S. Department of Labor-OIG in which Cooper or Dempewolfe are sender, recipient, copy, or subject.

 E. Data-Retention & Destruction Logs
  • Logs or certificates showing deletion or purge decisions affecting any of the requested items.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise indicated, this request covers 1 January 2018 to present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Please provide records in native electronic format (.pdf, .msg, .xlsx, .mp4) via secure download link.
 • If electronic transmission is impracticable, advise of alternative media (USB, disc).

V. Fee Waiver
 • Disclosure will illuminate potential agency misrepresentation and selective enforcement, subjects of significant public interest under State v. Timblin and Kaloti Enterprises, Inc. v. Kellogg Sales Co.; therefore, a fee waiver or reduction is requested.
 • If fees exceed $50, supply an itemized estimate before processing.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • Records are needed for imminent filings in federal civil-fraud and § 1983 litigation; timely access is essential.

VII. Record-Preservation Notice
 • Please preserve all potentially responsive material, even if subject to routine purge schedules.

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If portions are withheld, provide the segregable parts and cite each statutory exemption per Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Please acknowledge receipt by email and direct all clarifications to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I anticipate acknowledgment within ten business days, consistent with agency practice.

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon
 June 13, 2025


Citations:
Cases:
State v. Timblin
United States ex rel. O-Donnell v. Countrywide Home Loans, Inc.
Williams v. Rank & Son Buick, Inc.
Statutes:
See Kaloti Enterprises, Inc. v. Kellogg Sales Co., 283 Wis. 2d 555, 699 N.W.2d 205 (2005)
Restatement (Second) of Agency (1958)
Wisconsin Statutes—Theft by Fraud

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon
